titlestmt.titleproper: William Hening general store cash accounts 1836-1857
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: William Hening general store cash accounts
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: William Hening may have been the proprietor of a general store in the mid-nineteenth century, possibly in Maryland. He also appears to have performed various services, such as shoe repair, letting land for grazing of livestock, and house repairs. Customers listed in the book include Elizabeth Knight, on whose property Hening may have lived, Elijah Marker, George Marker, Samuel Wormley, Enoch Jinkins, and Dr. W.W. Walls.

scopecontent.p: This volume records general store cash accounts, 1836-1857. The entries document purchases of goods, cash received for sales, and accounts of various customers and seasonal employees, whose bills were paid by cash and by labor.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.
